attributes.action: Direct Ofcom to make it a legal obligation for Internet Service Providers to sell their broadband service based on a guaranteed minimum download speed that their service can provide, as at the moment the download speed advertised bears no relationship to the actual download speeds attainable by the majority of users, especially when the ISP’s hide behind their fair use policy.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: As Internet service providers won’t or can’t install the necessary equipment to provide the figures they quote in their adverts it is grossly unfair to the majority or users to pay for something that to all intents and purposes is an unreal figure. To the average user it feels as though they are being defrauded, as what they pay for is never going to be a reality.
